domino_project

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • domino_project.Tile

  • public class Tile
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a Tile of a Domino Game using 2 integers for the values written on it. This Tile is used in many types of Domino Game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tile(int t1, int t2)
      Class Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equalTile(Tile tile)
      This method checks if both of the values of the given Tile equal to the values of the Tile of this class(not necessary in the same order).
      int getDouble()
      Gets the value of any side of a Double Tile.
      int getSum()
      Gets the sum of the 2 values of a Tile
      int getT1()
      Return 1st value passed to the constructor
      int getT2()
      Return 2nd value passed to the constructor
      boolean isDouble()
      This method checks if both values of a Tile are the same.
      short matchSideOfTile(int tileNum)
      This method checks if the given integer(tile_num) matches any of the sides of this Tile.
      void reverseTile()
      This method reverses the values of a Tile. e.g. [3,1] to S [1,3]
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method creates a String Object representing a Tile like this : [t1|t2]

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tile

        public Tile(int t1,
            int t2)
        Class Constructor. Creates a Tile with given values(both positive integers in [0,6]).
        Parameters:
        t1 - 1st value (on one side) of Tile
        t2 - 2nd value (on the other side) of Tile

    • Method Detail

      • getT1

        public int getT1()
        Return 1st value passed to the constructor
        Returns:
        t1

      • getT2

        public int getT2()
        Return 2nd value passed to the constructor
        Returns:
        t2

      • reverseTile

        public void reverseTile()
        This method reverses the values of a Tile. e.g. [3,1] to S [1,3]

      • matchSideOfTile

        public short matchSideOfTile(int tileNum)
        This method checks if the given integer(tile_num) matches any of the sides of this Tile.
        Parameters:
        tileNum - a Tile Number to be checked if matches
        Returns:
        1:if 1st value of Tile matches tileNum 2:if 2nd value of Tile matches tileNum 3:if tileNum doesn't match any side of the Tile

      • equalTile

        public boolean equalTile(Tile tile)
        This method checks if both of the values of the given Tile equal to the values of the Tile of this class(not necessary in the same order).
        Parameters:
        tile - a Tile to be compared with
        Returns:
        true: if the given tile equals to the one of the class,otherwise false

      • isDouble

        public boolean isDouble()
        This method checks if both values of a Tile are the same.
        Returns:
        true if both values are the same,otherwise false

      • getDouble

        public int getDouble()
        Gets the value of any side of a Double Tile.
        Returns:
        t1 if Tile is Double,otherwise -1

      • getSum

        public int getSum()
        Gets the sum of the 2 values of a Tile
        Returns:
        sum An integer containing the sum of the 2 values of a Tile.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method creates a String Object representing a Tile like this : [t1|t2]
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representing the digital visualization of a Tile
